item.title: C and Assembly - Subtleties
item.description: Should I write this int flag = 0; # Boolean value, can only be 0 or 1 while(some_condition){ ... if(flag == 0) flag = 1; ... } or int flag = 0; while(some_condition){ ... flag = 1; ... } what performs better? While I was writing some C code I came up to this little question. In a while loop at a certain point we have to set a boolean flag’s value to 1.
